result.execSummary:
The defendant Cary P. Shaffer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cary P. Shaffer

records.addlTxt: from Interconnections (dated 10/4/16), submitted by Atty Kmiec
$2,658.00; 30 DTP, Failure to pay, civil judgment

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Ted Kmiec.  Clerk/S. Garcia.  Amended information filed.  The defendant pleads guilty to count 1; court finds the defendant guilty of count 1.  The court imposes a fine of $1,000.00 plus costs; 30 DTP or civil judgment.  Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample; written notice provided to defendant.
Court has reviewed and Denies Atty Kmiec's request for adjournment.

Email correspondence received from Atty Kmiec requesting to adjourn hearing on 8/5/16 to a change of plea date as there will be a resolution upon completion of counseling.
Status Conf. rescheduled to  8/5/16 at 11:30 AM and confirmed with Atty Kmiec in which he will notify defendant. DA's Office notified.
Court has reviewed and approves Atty Kmiec's request for adjournment with no objection by the DA's Office.
Email correspondence received from Atty Kmiec requesting to reschedule hearing on 7/15/16 due to a family issue in Chicago.

Exhibits 1 and 3 through 14.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Cary P. Shaffer, appeared with Attorney Theodore Bernard Kmiec Iii.   Clerk: PT
Sworn in and testified is State's witness: KPD Officer A. Jurgens.  DE is sworn in and testified. Exhibits 1 and 3 through 14 are received.  Parties rest and evidence is closed.  Closing arguments made.  Upon hearing testimony and arguments motion to suppress is denied.  Atty Kmiec requests adjournment of trial on 6/20/16 for an interlockatory appeal with no objection by the State as their witness will be unavailable that day.   Status Conf. on 7/15/16 at 9:40 AM.
